data.title: Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan is a valuable asset to the world of music He was well versed in song, ghazal, qawwali, classical and semi-classical
data.meta_description: Emperor Qawwali Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan has been away from his fans for 24 years but his Qawwalis and songs have kept him alive. Gained a lot of popularity.
data.text:

Emperor Qawwali Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan has been away from his fans for 24 years but his Qawwalis and songs have kept him alive. Gained a lot of popularity. Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan's real name was Pervez. His father Ustad Fateh Ali Khan and his uncle Ustad Mubarak Ali Khan were also famous teachers of poetry and music of their time.

Nusrat had four elder sisters and a younger brother Farrukh Fateh Ali Khan. Before partition, the family lived in the Basti Sheikh area of Jalandhar and later settled in Faisalabad. Nusrat Fateh was born on October 13, 1948, in Faisalabad. Ali Khan was the only Pakistani artist to set international records in a short period of time.

Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan was 16 years old when his father died in 1964 and he gave his first solo performance in public on his father's Chehlum.

After the death of Ustad Mubarak Ali Khan, the name of Qawal Group was suggested as "Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, Mujahid Mubarak Ali Khan and Party". What

Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan spent his entire life learning the art of Qawwali and popularizing it in the East and West.

He used to spend 24 hours in music, composing melodies all night long and he could not remember when it was morning. He had an innocent personality. He conveyed the message of Sufis to the corners of the world through Qawwali. Delivered and by his grace he himself gained immense fame. He sang verses and ghazals in Urdu, Punjabi, and Persian which were highly appreciated.

He also sang national anthems, of which "My Message Pakistan" is the most popular and resonates in the air on the occasion of August 14 every year. He also won several national and international awards. He also evoked the magic of sound in many Indian films. In particular, the song of the popular Bollywood film Dharkan "Dulha Ka Sehra Sahana Lagta Hai" was very popular. Many of his poems and songs have been sung by Pakistani and Indian singers in their own style.
